attributes.action: For an independent governing body to oversee the practise of social services
attributes.additional_details: Social services has the power to destroy lives. They are bound to make mistakes and when this happens there needs to be a governing body the public can turn to with complaints.
attributes.background: For the government to put an independent governing body in charge to oversee social services and their practises. To make them accountable for their actions.

rejection.details:
In England, Social Work England is responsible for regulating social workers. Social Work England is a non-departmental public body, operating at arm’s length from government, and was established by the Children and Social Work Act 2017. 

You can find out more about Social Work England here: https://www.socialworkengland.org.uk/about/our-role-and-legislation/

If you are concerned about something a social worker has done, you can find out how to raise a concern about this here: https://www.socialworkengland.org.uk/concerns/raise-a-concern/
